text: Does anyone know if anyone has studied social graphs to generate narratives? I have no idea what I am talking about but I would like to have a system in which I can show conspiracy as an emergent property.

elements.text: Does anyone know if anyone has studied social graphs to generate narratives? I have no idea what I am talking about but I would like to have a system in which I can show conspiracy as an emergent property.

text: This seems like a shower thought, but I'm intrigued.

elements.text: This seems like a shower thought, but I'm intrigued.

text: I assume you mean conspiracy theories?

elements.text: I assume you mean conspiracy theories?

text: I'm imagining that you might model them as stochastic automata on social graphs, where birth/death is a stochastic function of the "social" weight on edges.

elements.text: I'm imagining that you might model them as stochastic automata on social graphs, where birth/death is a stochastic function of the "social" weight on edges.

text: This model is more general than conspiracy theories, though-- applies to any sort of "viral" psychology.

elements.text: This model is more general than conspiracy theories, though-- applies to any sort of "viral" psychology.

text: It would be interesting to differentiate viral psychologies by properties of their corresponding social graph automata.

elements.text: It would be interesting to differentiate viral psychologies by properties of their corresponding social graph automata.

text: The usefulness of this model could be assessed by comparing the expected survival/prevalence of different viral psychologies on networks which usefully model social networks (small-world networks?) to those observed in reality.

elements.text: The usefulness of this model could be assessed by comparing the expected survival/prevalence of different viral psychologies on networks which usefully model social networks (small-world networks?) to those observed in reality.

text: Actually, it strikes me that my choice of words in using the phrase "viral psychology" is more apt than initially realised. This is sort of just a savvy sort of mathematical epidemiology.

elements.text: Actually, it strikes me that my choice of words in using the phrase "viral psychology" is more apt than initially realised. This is sort of just a savvy sort of mathematical epidemiology.
